visualization_prompt: Create a Highcharts chartOptions object to render a line chart with the following specifications: Chart type: line, Chart title: Monthly Average Temperature, Axes and labels styling: Use a dark gray color (#333) for axis labels and titles, with a font size of 14px. Data series: The data series should include monthly average temperatures for a year, with the name 'Temperature' and data points for each month. Custom colors: Use a gradient from blue to red for the line series. Additional configurations: Set the chart background to a light gray color (#f0f0f0), add a legend at the bottom of the chart, and configure the chart to allow zooming in both the x and y directions.
visualization_explanation: The provided Highcharts chartOptions object is configured to render a line chart with a title 'Monthly Average Temperature'. The chart allows for zooming in both the x and y directions and has a light gray background. The x-axis represents the months of the year, and the y-axis represents the temperature in degrees Celsius. Both axes have labels styled with a dark gray color and a font size of 14px. The data series is named 'Temperature' and includes monthly average temperature data points. The line series uses a gradient color from blue to red. Additionally, a legend is placed at the bottom of the chart for better readability.
